title: CRITICAL BUG: Validate Search Input node incorrectly rejecting valid input with parsedQuery
PHASE 2: Design Modular n8n Architecture
description:
Design the modular n8n workflow architecture to replicate PeopleHub functionality.

ARCHITECTURE REQUIREMENTS:
- Natural language query processing
- LinkedIn profile search and collection
- Data caching and storage
- AI research report generation
- User interface via n8n forms or webhook endpoints

WORKFLOW MODULES TO DESIGN:
1. Query Parser Workflow (replaces Gemini 2.0 parsing)
2. Search Execution Workflow (replaces Google Search + scraping)
3. Data Storage Workflow (replaces PostgreSQL + Redis)
4. Research Engine Workflow (replaces LangGraph)
5. Report Generation Workflow
6. API/Interface Workflow (replaces Next.js API routes)

DESIGN DELIVERABLES:
- Workflow architecture diagrams
- Data flow between workflows
- n8n node specifications
- Integration points and dependencies
- Error handling strategies
- Performance optimization plans

RESEARCH NEEDED:
- n8n capabilities and limitations
- Available n8n nodes for each function
- Data persistence options within n8n
- AI/LLM integration options in n8n

FOCUS: Modular design that can be implemented incrementally

title: CRITICAL: Fix Search Engine workflow - Replace invalid SerpStack node with HTTP Request
description:
The Search Engine workflow contains an invalid node type 'n8n-nodes-base.serpStack' that doesn't exist in n8n, causing 'Unrecognized node type' errors. This node needs to be replaced with an HTTP Request node that calls the SerpStack API directly.

CURRENT STATUS:
- Node has been replaced in workflow JSON file
- All node types validated against n8n supported nodes
- Need to test and deploy the corrected workflow

TECHNICAL DETAILS:
- Workflow ID: 8AG01PpnrYM1vsGE  
- Original node: n8n-nodes-base.serpStack
- Replacement: n8n-nodes-base.httpRequest
- API endpoint: https://api.serpstack.com/search
- File location: /Users/welovekiteboarding/Development/pepolehub/N8N/workflows/search-engine-workflow.json

title: Fix invalid webhookResponse node in Search Engine workflow
REBUILD: Convert PeopleHub Next.js App to n8n Workflows
description:
PROJECT GOAL: Replicate the entire PeopleHub functionality using n8n workflows instead of Next.js, achieving the same end results without using BrightData. Find alternative systems and services with free tiers and no required subscriptions.

CURRENT SYSTEM ANALYSIS:
- PeopleHub is an AI-powered LinkedIn intelligence platform
- Uses natural language queries for professional search
- Combines Google Gemini 2.0 for query parsing, Bright Data APIs for scraping, LangGraph for research workflows
- Features multi-tier caching (Redis + PostgreSQL) and AI research reports
- Tech stack: Next.js, Prisma, PostgreSQL, Redis, LangChain, Bright Data

CRITICAL CONSTRAINTS:
- Use beads for ALL planning and task management (no markdown TODOs)
- Research and facts ONLY - no guessing or assumptions
- Modular approach: build one workflow per goal, then integrate
- Update files frequently to prevent PAI context crashes
- All work in N8N folder
- Find free-tier alternatives to BrightData

PHASES:
1. RESEARCH: Analyze current repo functionality and research alternative services
2. DESIGN: Plan modular n8n workflow architecture  
3. IMPLEMENT: Build individual workflows
4. INTEGRATE: Connect workflows and test end-to-end
5. DEPLOY: Final deployment and documentation

IMMEDIATE NEXT STEPS:
1. Document current system architecture and data flows
2. Research BrightData alternatives with free tiers
3. Map current features to n8n workflow capabilities
4. Design modular workflow architecture

description: Add engineer's technical feasibility analysis and risk assessment to N8N documentation

✅ Create and test service accounts:
  - OpenAI (GPT-3.5 Turbo -  free credit)
  - SerpStack (1,000 free API calls/month)
  - SerpApi (100 free searches/month - backup)
  - Apify (10,000 free compute credits/month)
  - Proxycurl (1,000 free requests/month - backup)
  - Google Drive API (15GB free storage)

TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS:

- Service Research ✅ COMPLETED

NEXT STEP: Begin Query Parser workflow implementation

notes: FIXED: Root cause was incorrect n8n input structure access. Changed from  to  which is the correct n8n data access pattern. Updated both Validate Search Input and Construct Google Search Query nodes. Created comprehensive test suite that validates the fix works correctly.

title: Implement Search Engine n8n workflow
description:
Implement the Search Engine n8n workflow using SerpStack with SerpApi fallback

WORKFLOW IMPLEMENTATION TASKS:
✅ Create n8n workflow with webhook trigger (/search)
✅ Implement SerpStack integration (primary search service)
✅ Implement SerpApi fallback (backup search service)
✅ Add LinkedIn URL filtering and validation
✅ Implement query building from parsed parameters
✅ Add result quality scoring and ranking
✅ Include comprehensive error handling and fallbacks

TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS:
- Webhook endpoint: POST /search
- Primary service: SerpStack (1,000 free calls/month)
- Backup service: SerpApi (100 free calls/month)
- Output: Array of LinkedIn profile URLs with metadata
- Response time target: <8 seconds
- Results limit: 10 most relevant LinkedIn profiles

INPUT/OUTPUT CONTRACTS:
- Input: Parsed query from Query Parser workflow
- Output: Structured search results with relevance scores
- Error handling: Graceful degradation between services

NODES TO IMPLEMENT:
1. Webhook Trigger (POST /search)
2. Input Validation Code Node
3. Search Query Builder Code Node
4. SerpStack Integration Node (primary)
5. SerpStack Response Processing Code Node
6. Fallback Check IF Node
7. SerpApi HTTP Request Node (backup)
8. SerpApi Response Processing Code Node
9. Merge Results Node
10. Quality Filter Code Node
11. Format Response Set Node
12. Webhook Response Node

TESTING REQUIREMENTS:
- Valid search queries with various complexities
- Service failure scenarios (SerpStack down)
- No results scenarios (specific queries)
- Performance benchmarking (<8 seconds)
- LinkedIn URL validation accuracy

DELIVERABLES:
- Complete n8n workflow file (.json)
- Testing documentation and results
- Service integration validation
- Performance metrics and benchmarks

DEPENDENCIES:
- Query Parser workflow (apollo-fst) - provides input structure
- Service accounts (apollo-6me) - API keys required
- Architecture design (Phase 3) - implementation guide available

SUCCESS CRITERIA:
- Workflow successfully finds LinkedIn profiles
- Fallback service works when primary fails
- Result quality scoring improves relevance
- Error responses properly formatted
- Performance targets met (<8 second response)

comments.author: welovekiteboarding
comments.text:
Starting comprehensive analysis of current system architecture. Initial findings:

CURRENT API ENDPOINTS ANALYZED:
1. POST /api/search - Main search functionality with caching
2. POST/GET /api/research - Research report generation and listing  
3. GET /api/profiles/recent - Recent profiles API
4. GET /api/profiles/batch - Batch profile operations
5. GET /api/profile/[linkedinId]/route.ts - Individual profile data
6. GET /api/proxy-image - Image proxy for LinkedIn avatars

BRIGHT DATA INTEGRATION IDENTIFIED:
- Google Search API for LinkedIn URL discovery
- LinkedIn Scraper API (Dataset ID: gd_l1viktl72bvl7bjuj0)
- Web Scraper API for research content
- Polling mechanism with 10-minute timeout
- JSON response format with comprehensive profile data

LANGGRAPH RESEARCH ENGINE:
- 8-node workflow: Start → Fetch LinkedIn → Search → Scrape → Summarize → Aggregate → Report
- Parallel processing capabilities (fan-out/fan-in)
- State management with MemorySaver
- AI-powered query generation and content summarization
- Advanced filtering and deduplication

DATABASE SCHEMA (PostgreSQL):
- Person model with 22 fields including JSON columns
- Search model for query caching
- Research model for report generation
- Comprehensive indexing strategy

Continuing analysis of tech stack and data flows...

title: Fix JavaScript error in 'Construct Google Search Query' node - Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'jobTitles')
description: Critical JavaScript error in n8n workflow 'search-engine-workflow.json'. Node 'build-search-query' (Construct Google Search Query) is failing with 'Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'jobTitles')' on line 8. This suggests the parsedQuery object is undefined when the code tries to access parsedQuery.jobTitles. Need to add proper input validation and error handling to prevent workflow failures.

title: CRITICAL: SerpStack HTTP Request JSON parameter error in n8n V4.1
description:
PERSISTENT ISSUE: SerpStack HTTP Request node failing with 'JSON parameter needs to be valid JSON' error despite multiple fix attempts.

CURRENT STATE:
- n8n version: 1.120.4 (Self Hosted)
- HTTP Request node: n8n-nodes-base.httpRequest V4.1
- Workflow file: /Users/welovekiteboarding/Development/pepolehub/N8N/workflows/search-engine-workflow.json
- Error occurs at execution time, not JSON parsing

FAILED APPROACHES:
- Single-line JSON formatting
- Expression syntax with = prefix
- Multiple jsonBody parameter formats

REQUIRED INVESTIGATION:
1. Research n8n HTTP Request V4.1 correct parameter syntax
2. Try alternative configurations (GET with queryParameters, bodyParameters, etc.)
3. Test different request formats (sendHeaders + body)
4. Find working solution for SerpStack API integration

SERPSTACK API REQUIREMENTS:
- Endpoint: https://api.serpstack.com/search
- Method: GET with query parameters (access_key, query, engine, location, etc.)
- Need working HTTP Request configuration for n8n V4.1

CONSTRAINTS:
- Fix in REPO only
- Use beads for tracking
- Test multiple configuration approaches
- Research correct V4.1 syntax

title: Redesign repo architecture as n8n workflows
description: Analyze current repository architecture and redesign as simple n8n workflows to achieve same results. Create N8N folder with workflow files and documentation.

title: CRITICAL BUG: Validate Search Input node incorrectly rejecting valid input with parsedQuery
description:
The Validate Search Input node in search-engine-workflow.json has flawed validation logic that incorrectly rejects valid input.

CURRENT ISSUE:
- Input contains valid parsedQuery object with jobTitles array
- Node returns 'Invalid input format - missing parsedQuery' error
- This is a critical logic error preventing workflow execution

TEST INPUT (VALID):
{
  "originalQuery": "senior react developers in San Francisco",
  "parsedQuery": {
    "jobTitles": ["senior react developer"],
    "skills": ["react", "javascript"],
    "location": "San Francisco",
    "experience": 5,
    "keywords": ["senior", "frontend"],
    "companyType": "startup",
    "searchType": "people"
  }
}

CURRENT BROKEN OUTPUT:
{
  "success": false,
  "error": "Invalid input format - missing parsedQuery",
  "errorType": "validation_error"
}

TECHNICAL DETAILS:
- Node ID: validate-search-input
- File: /Users/welovekiteboarding/Development/pepolehub/N8N/workflows/search-engine-workflow.json
- Current validation: if (!inputData || !inputData.parsedQuery) - THIS IS WRONG
- The input DOES have parsedQuery, but logic is flawed

REQUIRED FIXES:
1. Debug the validation logic to understand why it's failing
2. Fix the JavaScript validation code in the node
3. Update to properly validate parsedQuery object structure
4. Test that correct input passes validation
5. Ensure proper error handling for truly invalid inputs

CONSTRAINTS:
- Fix in REPO only (workflow JSON file)
- Use proper JSON structure validation
- Test with provided valid input
- Maintain error handling for invalid inputs

title: Fix invalid webhookResponse node in Search Engine workflow
description: The Search Engine workflow contains an invalid node type 'n8n-nodes-base.webhookResponse' that doesn't exist in n8n. This causes the workflow to fail loading. The node needs to be replaced with a valid HTTP response node type while preserving the webhook response functionality. The workflow file is located at N8N/workflows/search-engine-workflow.json and contains 12+ nodes that need validation.
